metadata.title: CVE-2020-14331 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s implementation of the invert videocode on VGA consoles when a local attacker attempts to resize the console,calling an ioctl VT_RESIZE, which causes an out-of-bounds write to occur.This flaw allows a local user with access to the VGA console to crash thesystem, potentially escalating their privileges on the system. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity aswell as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14331` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1008-gcp - 5.3.0-1008.9~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1011-oracle - 5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was not-affected [config not enabled]').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was not-affected [config not enabled]').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-gcp-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1008.9~18.04.1').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2').
